msContents.summary: I-1) Maṣḥafa śǝrʿāt, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fols. 1ra-7vb, 88ra) I-2) Introductory exhortation (fols. 8ra-11va) I-3) ʾƎsaggǝd laki wa-ʾǝweddǝsaki... “I worship Thee…” (fols. 11va-12vb) I-4) Taʾāmra Māryām "Miracles of Mary": 76 Miracles (fols. 13ra-125vb) II) Taʾāmra ʾIyasus "Miracles of Jesus": 6 miracles (fols. 126ra-138vb, 144ra-144vb), the last miracle incomplete III) Taʾāmra Qirqos "Miracles of Cyricus": 4 miracles (fols. 139ra-141vb) IV) Salām laki ḫoḫǝtä mǝśraq... “Salutation to you, Threshold of the East…” (fol. 143ra) V) Taʾāmra Libānos "Miracles of Libānos": 1 miracle (fols. 143ra-144ra) Additio 1; colophon.

msItem.title: I. Taʾāmra Māryām “Miracles of Mary”
msItem.note: I-1) Maṣḥafa śǝrʿāt, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah; I-2) Introductory exhortation; I-3) ʾƎsaggǝd laki wa-ʾǝweddǝsaki “I Worship Thee…”; I-4) 76 miracles of Mary.

msItem.title: I-1) Maṣḥafa śǝrʿāt – Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah
msItem.incipit: 1ra, l.1: በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ፡ ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ተአምር፡ ዘይትነበብ፡ እምቅድመ፡ ያንብቡ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ሥርዓት፡ ዘወፅአ፡ እምንበረ፡ ማርቆስ፡ ሐዋርያ፡ እመካነ፡ መዓልቃ፡ ዘምስር፡ ዘአንበሩ፡ መምህራን፡ መጋብያነ፡ ምሥጢር፡ ርቱዓነ፡ ሃይማኖት።[1ra, l.1] In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, One God. This book of rules that came from the seat of Mark the Apostle, from the church of Mäʿalqa (al-Muʿallaqah) of Mǝsr (i.e. Cairo) wherein the doctors, the glorious patriarchs, the treasurers of the mystery, the righteous had laid it up.
msItem.explicit: 7vb, l.13: ለከ፡ ይደሉ፡ ስብሐት፡ በጽዮን፨ ወለከ፡ ይትፈና፡ ጸሎት፡ በኢየሩሳሌም፨ ስማዕ፡ ጸሎተ፡ ዘሥጋ፡…

note.p: In the margin, 6r: ወኢይመስሎ

1ra, l.1 - 5ra, l.4: Maṣḥafa śǝrʿāt (1st part); 5ra, l. 5 - 5va, l.1: Haleluya Haleluya salām la-Māryām nǝgǝśt; 5va, 16 - 6ra, l.11: salām to the Apostles; f.5va, 11 - 7vb, l.17: Maṣḥafa śǝrʿāt (2nd part)

msItem.title: I-2) Introductory exhortation
msItem.incipit: 8ra, l.1: መቅድመ፡ ተአምር፡ ዘይትነበብ፡ በሰንበተ፡ ክርስቲያን። ንነግረክሙ፡ አኃዊነ፡ ፍቁራን፡ ውሉደ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፨ እግዚአብሔር፡ ይባርክሙ፡ ወያብርህ፡ አዕይንተ፡ አልባቢክሙ፨ ለሰሚዓ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ በክልኤ፡ ማርያም፡…[8ra, l.1]: The foreword of the miracles which to be read during the Christian Sunday. We will tell you, our brothers, children of the church, may God bless you and enlighten the eyes of your hearts to listen to the miracles of our Lady Mary, the holy and twofold Virgin.
msItem.explicit: 11rb, l.15: ቅዱሳን፡ ወንጹሐን፡ ድንግልናኪ፡ እለ፡ ይሴብሑ። ኀበ፡ ሥዕልኪ፡ እንዘ፡ ይጸርኁ፡[11va] ብርሃነ፡ ጸጋኪ፡ ይትሞጥሑ፡ ኀበ፡ ቤተ፡ መርዓሁ፡ ለወልድኪ፡ ያንፈርዕፁ፡ ወይትፌሥሑ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ በስራሕ፨

note.p: 8ra - 10ra, l.1: Introductory exhortation;
10ra, l.2 - 10rb, l.2: ʾO ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl bäkǝlʾe Māryām ṣalotǝki wäbarakatǝki… (cf.UM-014,UM-016);
f.10va, l.10 - 11va, l.6: salām laki o ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä Māryām ʾǝmu la-bǝrhān (cf.UM-014,UM-016,UM-029).

msItem.title: I-3) ʾƎsaggǝd laki wa-ʾǝweddǝsaki “I worship Thee…”
msItem.incipit: 11va, l.7: እሰግድ፡ ለኪ፡ እሰግድ፡ ለኪ፡ ወእዌድሰኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትየ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ለመርዓዊ፡ {ሰማይ}፡ ጽርሑ፨ በከመ፡ ወደስኪ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ አፈ፡ ወርቅ፡ በመኃልይሁ፡…
msItem.explicit: 12vb, l.1: ኦእግዝእትየ፡ ማርያም፡ ሰአሊ፡ ወጸልዪ፡ ኀበ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልድኪ፡ ከመ፡ ይስረይ፡ ለነ፡ ኃጣውኢነ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨

msItem.title: I-4) Miracles of Mary
msItem.incipit: 13ra, l.1 (Miracle 1): በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አሐዱ፡ ወመንፈስ [sic]፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ፡ ንቀድም፡ በረድኤተኤተ[sic]፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢያሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወበስነ፡ ሀብቱ፡ በጽሒፈ፡ ተአምረሃ፡ ለእግዚእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ በክልኤ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ዘኢይክሉ፡ ፈጽሞ፡ ነጊረ፡ ዕበያ፡ ወክብራ፡ ወውዳሴሃ፡ ኢሰማያውያን፡ ወኢምድራውያን፡ ጸሎታ፡ ወበረከታ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ዓመታ፡…
msItem.explicit: 125vb, l.3 (Miracle 79): ወዕለቱ፡ አመ፡ ፯፡ ለነሐሴ፡ ርእዩኬ፡ ዘከመ፡ ታፈቅር፡ ወትረድኦሙ፡ ለክርስቲያን፡ ወታወድቆሙ፡ ለአረሚ፡ አግብርተ፡ ሠይጣን፨ እግዚእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ በረከተ፡ ጸሎታ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ አግብርቲሃ፡…

note.p: I-3)-1: 13ra-14vb: About Ildefonsus (Däqǝsyos) of Toledo (Ṭǝlṭǝlyaya)

(BMirMA 10-12; BHMirM 1-4; CerMaria310-316; ColMirM 23-24 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 100, n32, I, D.-7; éth. 60, fols. 8-10, ZotBNat 62, n60-1; Orient. 8814, fols.98r-100v, StrBritLib 46, n32, 16.-1).
I-3)-2: 15ra-15rb: End of an undefined miracle.
I-3)-3. 15rb-16va: The Virgin Mary protects a pregnant woman from drowning during the feast of St Michael (ColMirM 50-51).

I-3)-4. 16va-19rb: The Virgin Mary and the cannibal of Qǝmǝr (BMirMA 46-47; BHMirM 94-97; ColMirM176-180// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 102, n32, I, D.-29; éth. 60, 49-52, ZotBNat 63, n60-30; Orient. 8814, fols. 156v-160r, StrBritLib 48, n32, 16.-29).

I-3)-5. 19rb-19vb: The death of Nestorius (CerMaria213-215// mss. d´Abbadie 165, fols. 100r-100v, CRAbb 82, n52; d´Abbadie 222, 45v-46r, CRAbb 85, n53; Vat. Et. 43, fols.232-333, GréTisVat I 188, n43).
I-3)-6. 19vb-20va: About three virgins who served Mary (mss. d´Abbadie 165, fols.99v-100r, CRAbb 82, n52).

I-3)-7. 20va-21rb: The spring of Mǝḥṣab, part of the Synaxarium of 8 Sane (GuiSyn I568-570, CerMaria 29, 37 // mss. éth. 60, fols. 147v-148, ZotBNat 66, n60-85; éth. 62, 38v-39v, ZotBNat 68, n60-25; O Ethiop. 11, LöfUpp 89, n30, F.-6).
I-3)-8. 21rb-22rb: The Virgin Mary, on a chariot with her son and crowned with pearls, appeared to the Apostles.
I-3)-9. 22rb-22vb: Apparition of Mary to John Chrysostom (mss. éth. 60, fols. 173v-174, ZotBNat 67, no.60-104).
I-3)-10. 23ra-24vb: Miracle of the sycamore at Dabra Mǝṭmaq (mss. éth. 60, fols. 135v-137v, ZotBNat 66, n60-79).
I-3)-11. 24vb-27va:The Virgin Mary cursed an Egyptian woman who did not want to give them water (mss. éth. 60, fols. 144v-147v, ZotBNat 66, n60-84).
I-3)-12. 27va-29ra: The Virgin Mary destroyed an Egyptian town whose inhabitants did not accommodate the holy family well (mss. éth. 60, fols. 137v-139, ZotBNat 66, n60-80).
I-3)-13. 29ra-30rb: The Virgin Mary cursed inhabitants of an Egyptian town in turning them into baboons (mss. éth. 60, fols. 140v-142, ZotBNat 66, n60-82).
I-3)-14. 30va-32va: About the king of an Egyptian town who invited the Virgin Mary and three thousand inhabitants were cured (mss. éth. 60, fols.142-144, ZotBNat 66, n60-83).
I-3)-15. 32va-33ra: The Virgin Mary appeared to a poor monk who had no food and clothes who prays her every day.

I-3)-16. 33ra-33vb: The Virgin Mary and the workman (BMirMA 13; BHMirM 6-7 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, n32, I, D.-9; éth. 60, 11-12, ZotBNat 62, n60-3; Orient. 8814, fols. 100v-101r, StrBritLib 46, n32,16.-2).

I-3)-17. 33vb-34va: The Jew of the city of Akhmim (BMirMA 14; BHMirM 8-9; CerMaria219-225; ColMirM452-453// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, n32, I, D.-10; éth. 60, 12-13, ZotBNat 62, n60-4; Orient. 8814, fols. 101r-103v, StrBritLib 46, n32, 16.-3).

I-3)-18. 34va-35rb: The Virgin Mary and the scribe Damianus (Dǝmyanos) of Philippi (Fǝlǝṗäsyos) (BMirMA 15; BHMirM 10-13; ColMirM 512 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, n32, I, D.-11; éth. 60, 13-14, ZotBNat 62, n60-5; Orient. 8814, fols. 103v-104v, StrBritLib 46, n32, 16.-4).

I-3)-19. 35rb-36ra: The Virgin Mary and bishop ʾAbbas (the pope Leon) (BMirMA 14-16; BHMirM 14-16; CerMaria436-444// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, n32, I, D.-12; éth. 60, 14-15v, ZotBNat 62, n60-6; Orient. 8814, fols. 104v-106v, StrBritLib 47, n32, 16.-5).

I-3)-20. 36ra-37ra: The Virgin Mary and monk Isaac (BMirMA 17-18; BHMirM 20-22; ColMirM 265-273// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, n32, I, D.-13; éth. 60, 15v-17, ZotBNat 62, n60-7; Orient. 8814, fols. 106v-108v, StrBritLib 47, n32, 16.-6).

I-3)-21. 37va-38rb: The Virgin Mary and the child Mary of Däfra (BHMirM 23-25; BMirMA 18-19; CerMaria191-194// mss. éth. 60, 17-18, ZotBNat 62, n60-8; Orient. 8814, fols. 108v-110v, StrBritLib 47, n32-7).

I-3)-22. 38rb-39rb: The Virgin Mary and the painter decorating a church in France (hagärä Afransa) (BMirMA 19-20; BHMirM 26-32 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, n32, I, D.-15; éth. 60, 18-19v, ZotBNat 62, n60-9; Orient. 8814, fols. 110v-112v, StrBritLib 47, n32, 16.-8).

I-3)-23. 39rb-39vb: The Virgin Mary and the sick monk in the ‟Monastery of Pilgers” (Dabra Näggadǝyan) (BMirMA 20-21; BHMirM 33-34; CerMaria 192 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, n32, I, D.-16; éth. 60, 19v-20v, ZotBNat 63, n60-10; Orient. 8814, fols. 112v-114r, StrBritLib 47, n32, 16.-9).

I-3)-24. 39vb-41ra: The Virgin Mary and the youth Zachary (BMirMA 21-22; BHMirM 35-37; ColMirM 85-86 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 100, n32, I, D.-1; éth. 60, 20v-22v, ZotBNat 63, n60-11; Orient. 8814, fols. 114r-117v, StrBritLib 47, n32, 16.-10).
I-3)-25. 41ra-42rb: The two women, the robbers and the flute.

I-3)-26. 42rb-43ra: The Virgin Mary and the church of ʿƎqona, which was moved to the edge of the sea (BMirMA 25; BHMirM 45-46; ColMirM 171// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 100, n32, I, D.-4; éth. 60, 24v-25v, ZotBNat 63, n60-14; Orient. 8814, fols.121v-123v, StrBritLib 47, n32, 16.-13).

I-3)-27. 43ra-44ra: The Virgin Mary and the blind Egyptian Priest John Bäkänsi (BMirMA 26-27; BHMirM 47-49; ColMirM283-284// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 100, n32, I, D.-5; éth. 60, 25v-27, ZotBNat 63, n60-15; Orient. 8814, fols. 123v-126r, StrBritLib 47, n32, 16.-14).

I-3)-28. 44ra-45vb: The Virgin Mary and the man of the island of Qʷäläsyǝs who had a dart in his eye (BMirMA 28-29; BHMirM 53-55; ColMirM285-286// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 100, n32, I, D.-6; éth. 60, 27-28, ZotBNat 63, n60-16; Orient. 8814, fols. 126r-128r, StrBritLib 47, n32, 16.-15).

I-3)-29. 44vb-46ra: The Virgin Mary and the blind girl Elisabeth of Bädrǝman (BMirMA 27-28; BHMirM 53-56; ColMirM185-186// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, n32, I, D.-18; éth. 60, 28-30, ZotBNat 63, n60-17; Orient. 8814, fols. 128r-131r, StrBritLib 47, n32, 16.-16).

I-3)-30. 46ra-46vb: The Virgin Mary and Bishop Mercurius (BMirMA 36-37; BHMirM 71-72; ColMirM287-288// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, n32, I, D.-24; éth. 60, 37v-38v, ZotBNat 63, n60-24; Orient. 8814, fols. 142r-144r, StrBritLib 47, n32, 16.-23).
I-3)-31. 46vb-47va: The Virgin Mary and the epileptic (BMirMA 275 variation).
I-3)-32. 47va-48vb: The Virgin Mary and the governor ʾArmatyas of Ephesus (ColMirM188-189// mss. d´Abbadie 222, 59v-60v, CRAbb 85, n53-XL).
I-3)-33. 48vb-49rb: The Virgin Mary and the priest John of the monastery of Macarius (Mäqarǝs) (ColMirM 337).
I-3)-34. 49rb-50rb: The resurrection of the son of a rich man of Cappadocia (Qäpdäqya) (ColMirM 130).

I-3)-35. Fols 50rb-51rb: The Virgin Mary and the thirsty dog (BMirMA 51-52; BHMirM 112 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 102, n32, I, D.-32; éth. 60, 56-57, ZotBNat 63, n60-33; Orient. 8814, fols. 165v-167v, StrBritLib 48, n32, 16.-32).
I-3)-36. 51rb-54va: The Virgin Mary and the holy communion in Cyprus (E. Cerulli, “Two Ethiopian Tales on the Christian of Cyprus”, JES 5-1: 1-4; EAE I “Cyprus”).
I-3)-37. 54va-56ra: The young man and the image of the Virgin placed on the gate of the town, on which she lowered her head each time he prostrated in front of it.
I-3)-38. 56ra-57rb: The Virgin Mary and the beekeeper (BHMirM341-342).
I-3)-39. 57rb-58rb: The journey of a pious knight on the skies.
I-3)-40. 58rb-59va: Apparition of the Virgin Mary to a sinful deacon in “the town of the island”.
I-3)-41. 59va-61rb: Isaac, son of king of Roma Mäsfǝnyos and of his wife Sǝfǝngya (mss. d´Abbadie 165, 62v-63v, CRAbb 80, n52-LVII; O Eth. 11, LöfUpp 93, n30-51).
I-3)-42. 61rb-62vb: Daniel of Constantinople and an image of the Virgin Mary.
I-3)-43. 62vb-63va: Andrew and Bartholomew and the priest ploughing his land on Sunday.
I-3)-44. 63va-65ra: How the Virgin Mary showed everything they want to people assembled in Dabra Mǝṭmaq (ColMirM208-210).
I-3)-45. 65ra-66ra: The Virgin Mary showed hell and heaven to a Roman (Romawi) monk of Dabra Kʷuzara called ʿOṣ (mss. éth. 60, fols.130-131, ZotBNat 65, n60-73).
I-3)-46. 66ra-68vb: Apparition of the Virgin Mary to Ephraim the Potter (The Syrian) (ColMirM373-375).
I-3)-47. 68vb-69rb: The Virgin Mary and the three monks of Toledo.
I-3)-48. 69rb-70ra: The great sadness of the Virgin Mary: Miracle read during the Good Friday (Gǝbra Ḥǝmāmāt, zäʿarb, Addis Abäba, 1942 E.C., p. 271).

I-3)-49. 70ra-70va: Jesus Christ and angels will judge the whole world in a church dedicated to the Virgin Mary and located in the valley of Josaphat (Yosafǝṭ) of Jerusalem (mss. EMML 4618, 125v, EMML X 239 no 4618-98; EMML 5492, 24v // EAE II Dabra Ṣǝyon).

item.desc: - Readings are indicated by the names of the feasts and other occasions written in the upper margin, in the main hand Fol. 15r: ወሶበ፡ ጸሐፈ፡ ደቅስዮስ። በሚካኤል፡ ምንባብ Fol. 19r: በቅ[n.l.]፡ አድኅኖ፡ ለበላዒ Fol. 19v: በደናግል፡ ምንባብ Fol. 20v: ዘዓንቅዓ፡ ማይ Fol. 21r: በቅደሴ፡ ቤታ Fol. 23r: በልደታ፡ ወበደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ ምንባብ Fol. 33r: አኮኑ፡ ብእሲ Fol. 33v: ሰበ፡ ወሀበኪ፡ ዘልፈ Fol. 34v: አብራዊ፡ ብፁዕ Fol. 35r: ለድምያኖስ፡ ዘጸሞጺኪ (?) Fol. 36r: አመ፡ እዴሁ፡ መተረ፡ ነሢኦ Fol. 37r: ይስሐቅ፡ መነኮስ Fol. 38r: ዘአትሎኪያ፡ ማ Fol. 39r: ምስለ፡ ዓራቱ፡ ዘዕፅ Fol. 39v: ዓፀደ፡ ማርያም Fol. 41r: ዘካርያስ፡ መሬዛ Fol. 42r: አረባውያን፡ እደው Fol. 43r: ኃይለኪ፡ ጽኑዓ፡ ወመንከረኪ Fol. 44r: ተወኪፈኪ፡ ስእለቶ፡ እ፡፡ (?) person.persName: The names of ʿAmda Masqal and ʾAwad are written in the supplications formulas in quires XI-XIII, in hand a. Further names are mentioned in the concluding formula on 125vb: Gabra Dǝngǝl, ʿAsbä Māryām, ʿAmda Giyorgis. Walatta Krǝstos is mentioned in the supplications formulas in quires XIV-XV, in hand b. In addition, Kǝfla Māryām is mentioned as the commissioner on 138r. ʾAbuna Kǝfla Māryām is also mentioned in the supplication formulas in quire XVI.
